content.raw:
A little more detail about the typical expectations for these arguments would be very helpful.

Should they be a list of paths to plugins? Can they contain additional information? Are there other resources available that you can link to from here with more details?
content.html:
A little more detail about the typical expectations for these arguments would be very helpful.

Should they be a list of paths to plugins? Can they contain additional information? Are there other resources available that you can link to from here with more details?

pull_request.title: Overload SetupClient() and SetupServer() with std::vector<std::string>

pullrequest.title: Overload SetupClient() and SetupServer() with std::vector<std::string>

content.html:
strdup allocates but I don't see a corresponding delete. Here is my version of this in case you wish to use some/all of it:

namespace detail {
    char* c_str(std::string & s)
    {
        char *pc = new char[s.size()+1];
        std::strcpy(pc, s.c_str());
        return pc;
    }

    void callWithStringVector(std::vector<std::string> vs, boost::function<bool (int, char**)> function)
    {
        std::vector<char*>  vc;
        std::transform(vs.begin(), vs.end(), std::back_inserter(vc), c_str);
        function(vc.size(),&vc[0]);
        for ( size_t i = 0 ; i < vc.size() ; i++ )
            delete [] vc[i];
    }
} // namespace detail
